# Issue Templates Guide for Teachers

This guide explains how to use the issue templates to request changes to the Mergington High School Activities application.

## Available Templates

When you create a new issue on GitHub, you'll see several template options. Choose the one that best matches your need:

### 1. üêõ Bug Report
**Use when:** Something isn't working correctly in the application.

**What you'll provide:**
- Description of what's broken
- Steps to reproduce the problem
- What should happen vs. what actually happens
- Which part of the app is affected

**Example:** "When I try to register a student for Chess Club, the button doesn't respond."

---

### 2. ‚ú® Add New Activity
**Use when:** You want to add a new extracurricular activity to the system.

**What you'll provide:**
- Activity name and description
- Category (Sports, Arts, Academic, etc.)
- Schedule (which days and what times)
- Maximum number of participants

**Example:** "I want to add a new Cooking Club that meets on Wednesdays from 3:30-5:00 PM."

---

### 3. üé® UI Improvement
**Use when:** You want to improve how the website looks or works.

**What you'll provide:**
- What currently needs improvement
- What you'd like to see instead
- Which area of the interface needs changes
- How this will help teachers and students

**Example:** "The activity cards are hard to read. I'd like larger text and better spacing."

---

### 4. üìù Modify Existing Activity
**Use when:** You need to change details about an activity that already exists.

**What you'll provide:**
- Which activity to modify
- What needs to change (name, schedule, description, etc.)
- Why the change is needed
- How urgent it is

**Example:** "Chess Club needs to move from Monday/Friday to Tuesday/Thursday due to room availability."

---

### 5. üí° Feature Request
**Use when:** You want to suggest completely new functionality.

**What you'll provide:**
- Description of the new feature
- What problem it solves
- How you imagine it working
- Who will benefit from it

**Example:** "Add the ability to export student registration lists to a spreadsheet."

---

## How to Create an Issue

1. Go to the repository's **Issues** tab
2. Click **New Issue**
3. Choose the appropriate template
4. Fill in all required fields (marked with red asterisks)
5. Click **Submit new issue**

## What Happens Next?

Once you submit an issue:
1. It will be reviewed by the development team
2. If the description is clear enough, a Copilot coding agent can be assigned
3. The agent will implement the changes based on your requirements
4. You'll be notified when the work is complete

## Tips for Writing Good Issues

‚úÖ **Do:**
- Be specific about what you need
- Provide examples when possible
- Fill in all required fields
- Explain why the change is needed

‚ùå **Don't:**
- Leave required fields blank
- Assume technical knowledge
- Combine multiple unrelated requests in one issue
- Use vague descriptions like "make it better"

## Need Help?

If you're not sure which template to use or need assistance:
- Start a [Discussion](https://github.com/benjaminbales/skills-expand-your-team-with-copilot/discussions)
- Refer to the [Development Guide](../docs/how-to-develop.md)
- Ask another teacher or the school tech coordinator

---

*Remember: The more detail you provide, the easier it will be for the Copilot coding agent to implement your request correctly!*
